meanings.sent1: The scraggy dog looked hungry and frail.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the scraggy branches on the old tree.
meanings.sent3: The scraggy scarecrow made the birds laugh.
meanings.sent4: The scraggy shadows of the night danced eerily.
meanings.sent5: The scraggy mannequin in the store window was unsettling.

meanings.sent1: His scraggy hands felt rough against her skin.
meanings.sent2: The scraggy surface of the rock scratched his palm.
meanings.sent3: The scraggy towel was not comfortable to use.
meanings.sent4: The scraggy road caused the car to bump and shake.
meanings.sent5: The scraggy fabric irritated her sensitive skin.

meanings.sent1: He tried to scraggy his opponent during the fight.
meanings.sent2: The villain attempted to scraggy the hero with a rope.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would scraggy his audience with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The vines seemed to scraggy the tree in a tight embrace.
meanings.sent5: The scarf threatened to scraggy her if she didn't untangle it quickly.
